content: fuzzy bonnet by casey materials 4 5 mm circular needles 4 5mm double-pointed needles optional 4mm circular needles 4mm double pointed needle 3 mm crochet hook 8 ply yarn 200g while any fibre can be used i recommend using mohair or a fluffy yarn for best results alternatively you can use 1 strand of lace weight 3 ply yarn held together with 1 strand of sport weight yarn 5 ply 200g of each any configuration that will result in the correct gauge can be used gauge 18 sts x 26 row 10cm x 10cm construction the bonnet is knit from the top down in one piece featuring a loose hood- like fit the pattern incorporates both knitting and crochet techniques and an i-cord trim is included to provide a neater edge around the face knit component the hood of the bonnet starting at the top of the head and continuing downwards crochet component last step crocheting tie onto the knit edge knit component i-cord edging to frame face pattern hood with 4 5mm circular needles cast on 19 sts using the long-tail cast-on method row 1 knit across all stitches row 2 purl across row 3-45 repeat row 1 and 2 the piece should measure 15cm stitches now need to be picked up around what has just been knit approximately for every 3 sts pick up 2 30 side 19 already on needles 30 side total of 79 stitches 4 5mm double-pointed needles can be used for this section if needed row 1 rs knit across row 2 ws purl across knit in stockinette for 19cm ending on a ws 50 row total cast off loosely i-cord edge step 1 using 4mm circular needles pick up every stitch along the front of the hood 119sts step 2 cast on 3 sts using the backward loop cast-on step 3 with a 4mm double-pointed needle k2 ssk then slip the 3 sts back to the left needle purl-wise repeat step 3 for every stitch picked up along the front of the hood once all stitches have been knit cast off the 3 remaining stitches crochet band row 1 using a 3mm crochet hook chain 55 connect chain to the bottom edge of hood starting at i-cord edge by single crocheting into every stitch along the cast- off edge then chain 55 sts or if you want your band longer replace the two chain 55 to your desired length row 2 single_crochet across row 3 2 single_crochet in 1st stitch single_crochet across until 1 stitch is left 2sc row 4 single_crochet across row 5-8 repeat row 3 and 4 6 stitches have been increased row 9 single_crochet 2 together single_crochet until 2 stitches single_crochet 2 together row 10 single_crochet across row 11- 14 repeat row 9 and 10 6 stitches have been decreased secure and weave in any loose ends and you re done
